alert.note: Alert for Early (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 26 at 5:31PM EDT by NWS Tallahassee
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southeastern Henry, northeastern Houston and northern Early Counties through 615 PM EDT/515 PM CDT/... At 531 PM EDT/431 PM CDT/, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 6 miles northwest of Columbia to near Webb to near Dothan. Movement was east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Blakely, Headland, Dothan, Kinsey, Cowarts, Arlington, Webb, Columbia, Centerville, Haleburg, Tumbleton, Sigma, Grandberry Crossroads, Rock Hill, Barber, Pleasant Plains, Headland Municipal A/P, Early Co A/p, Farley Nuclear Plant and Smyrna. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. These storms may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 700 PM EDT/600 PM CDT/ for southeastern Alabama.
